fields.description:
When using the eureport-export-data command, there are extra characters are added in the format of the .dat file (Please see the ":" in the beginning after "<"):

{code}
<:Export xmlns:="http://www.eucalyptus.com/ns/reporting/export/2012-08-24/">
.....
<:UsageBag>
<:Usage Metric="DiskReadBytes" Id="8a1f8b9d3dad14fd013dc24ac3db4475" Dimension="root" Type="ec2.instance" Created="2013-03-31T21:11:52.539Z" Value="3.98846464E8" Occurred="2013-03-31T22:43:50.783Z" Sequence="236" TargetId="f7f1f631-90cf-45dc-bd0b-da941b5c00ac">
</:Usage>
.....
</:UsageBag>
{code}

_*NOTE:*When running this on 3.2.2, the ":" was not present after the "<"._

This caused errors when uploading the report to the datawarehouse via eucadw-import-data:

{code}
2013-04-12 13:09:53 DEBUG 000000001 ConnectionManager        | releasing JDBC connection [ (open PreparedStatements: 0, globally: 0) (open ResultSets: 0, globally: 0)]
2013-04-12 13:09:53 DEBUG 000000001 eucalyptus_reporting     | #1 - autoCommit reset back to true
Error processing command: Error parsing document (line 2, col 1, in ReportingExport)
2013-04-12 13:09:53 ERROR 000000001 ImportCommand            | Error processing command
java.lang.RuntimeException: Error parsing document (line 2, col 1, in ReportingExport)
	at com.eucalyptus.util.Exceptions.toUndeclared(Exceptions.java:238)
	at com.eucalyptus.util.Exceptions.toUndeclared(Exceptions.java:244)
	at com.eucalyptus.reporting.dw.commands.ImportCommand.runCommand(ImportCommand.java:62)
	at com.eucalyptus.reporting.dw.commands.CommandSupport.run(CommandSupport.java:77)
	at com.eucalyptus.reporting.dw.commands.ImportCommand.main(ImportCommand.java:67)
Caused by: org.jibx.runtime.JiBXException: Error parsing document (line 2, col 1, in ReportingExport)
	at org.jibx.runtime.impl.StAXReaderWrapper.next(StAXReaderWrapper.java:302)
	at org.jibx.runtime.impl.UnmarshallingContext.toStart(UnmarshallingContext.java:446)
	at org.jibx.runtime.impl.UnmarshallingContext.unmarshalElement(UnmarshallingContext.java:2725)
	at com.eucalyptus.binding.Binding.fromStream(Binding.java:304)
	at com.eucalyptus.reporting.export.Import$2.call(Import.java:155)
	at com.eucalyptus.reporting.export.Import$2.call(Import.java:101)
	at com.eucalyptus.reporting.export.Import.transactional(Import.java:164)
	at com.eucalyptus.reporting.export.Import.doImport(Import.java:101)
	at com.eucalyptus.reporting.export.Import.importData(Import.java:78)
	at com.eucalyptus.reporting.export.Import.importData(Import.java:70)
	at com.eucalyptus.reporting.dw.commands.ImportCommand.runCommand(ImportCommand.java:45)
	... 2 more
Caused by: com.ctc.wstx.exc.WstxUnexpectedCharException: Unexpected character ':' (code 58) (missing namespace prefix?)
 at [row,col {unknown-source}]: [2,2]
	at com.ctc.wstx.sr.StreamScanner.throwUnexpectedChar(StreamScanner.java:612)
	at com.ctc.wstx.sr.StreamScanner.parseLocalName(StreamScanner.java:1718)
	at com.ctc.wstx.sr.BasicStreamReader.handleStartElem(BasicStreamReader.java:2888)
	at com.ctc.wstx.sr.BasicStreamReader.handleRootElem(BasicStreamReader.java:2055)
	at com.ctc.wstx.sr.BasicStreamReader.nextFromProlog(BasicStreamReader.java:2035)
	at com.ctc.wstx.sr.BasicStreamReader.next(BasicStreamReader.java:1106)
	at org.jibx.runtime.impl.StAXReaderWrapper.next(StAXReaderWrapper.java:240)
	... 12 more
2013-04-12 13:09:53 DEBUG 000000008 ShutdownHook             | Running ShutdownHook
2013-04-12 13:09:53  INFO 000000008 eucalyptus_reporting     | Shutting down 'eucalyptus_reporting' pool immediately [Shutdown Hook]
{code}

*Question*

Was there a bug in 3.2.1 regarding reporting that fixed this issue?

*Workaround*

Current workaround is to remove all the ":" from the incorrect positions:

{code}
sed -i -e 's/<:/</g' acmereport_aprl1t112013.dat
sed -i -e 's/<\/:/<\//g' acmereport_aprl1t112013.dat
sed -i -e 's/xmlns:/xmlns/g' acmereport_aprl1t112013.dat
{code}

Then the data can be imported as follows:

{code}
eucadw-import-data -e  acmereport_aprl1t112013.dat -p mypassword 
{code}
fields.summary: eureport-export-data provides incorrect data format that can't be imported

comments.body: Need to talk about this in the bug scrub.  Should be a high, targeted for a 3.3.x release.
[~viglesias], can you comment on the test plan for 3.3.0 for reporting?
Test cases are in the 3.3.0 Regression plan.
[~chuck] is this a duplicate of EUCA-5736?

[~graziano], Looking at both case I'm not 100% sure they are duplicate or if they are simply cause/effect. Regardless, they are currently both related and [~mmunn1] is currently assigned EUCA-5736. I'll ask him the question.

I am not able to reproduce EUCA-5736 or EUCA-5887 on 3.3.  Here is what I tried:

1) eureport-export-data test -s 2013-06-13 -e 2013-06-18

2) eucadw-import-data -e test -p mypassword

3) eucadw-generate-report -D -E -s 2013-06-13 -e 2013-06-18 -t instance -p mypassword > debug-output-report 2>&1

I have attached the above output as debug-output-report. Please try this on Euca 3.3 and let me know if I am missing anything?

After speaking with engineering about this issue (Ken) I was Informed that importing data from an earlier major release is not supported.
Example importing data from 3.2 into 3.3 is not supported.  This is because of database and formatting changes between major versions.
When upgrading the customer is expected to export the old data and save it externally. I have tested exporting and importing data from 3.3 to 3.3 
and it works as expected. I am closing this as not a bug
[~mmunn1], [~smarvin], is this doc'd?   if not, its worth doing!
Scott Marvin, Tim Cramer: I cannot find this documented anywhere?

[~mmunn1], what am i suppose to doc? I'm also confused because, as I read the comments, it seems like this is no longer an issue at 3.3.

(i.e., can you dumb it down for the late-to-the-party doc guy?)
Scott Marvin : We need to doc that importing data from an earlier major release is not supported. Example importing data from 3.2 into 3.3 is not supported

Thanks [~mmunn1]. However, that was the confusing part for me. Questions:

Is this ongoing? I mean, will folks upgrading from 3.3 to 3.4 have this problem? If so, what's the work-around?

Is this only a problem for folks upgrading to 3.3.x?
[~shashi], if this is needed, please make sure to get this onto the engineering backlog to add support for upgrade of reporting data

[~tjcramer], Are you saying that honoring existing reporting data in a Eucalyptus cloud during an upgrade of the cloud needs to be tracked as a "feature" request? Sorry, entering this thread late, so I may be missing something. 

If I understand this correctly, reporting data stored in the db alongside CLC will be retained while upgrading from 3.2 to 3.3. But if the reporting data is stored in bodega, then we have a bug that does not allow us to retain reporting data during upgrade from 3.2 to 3.3. Is that correct?
